Count distinct elements for each level of hierarchy per sample

Source: R/AnalysisConfiguration.R
hierarchy_counts_sample.Rd

Count distinct elements for each level of hierarchy per sample

hierarchy_counts_sample(pdata, configuration, nr_children = 1)

Arguments

pdata

data.frame

config

AnalysisConfiguration

See also

Other summary: INTERNAL_FUNCTIONS_BY_FAMILY, hierarchy_counts(), nr_B_in_A_per_sample(), summarize_hierarchy()

Examples


bb <- prolfqua::sim_lfq_data_peptide_config()
#> creating sampleName from fileName column
#> Warning: no nr_children column specified in the data, adding column nr_children and setting to 1.
#> completing cases

config <- bb$config
data <- bb$data
res <- hierarchy_counts_sample(data, config)
res()
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName protein_Id peptide_Id
#>    <chr>        <chr>           <int>      <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1               10         23
#>  2 light        A_V2               10         26
#>  3 light        A_V3               10         25
#>  4 light        A_V4               10         23
#>  5 light        B_V1                8         26
#>  6 light        B_V2                9         26
#>  7 light        B_V3               10         27
#>  8 light        B_V4               10         26
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1            10         24
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2            10         25
#> 11 light        Ctrl_V3             9         24
#> 12 light        Ctrl_V4            10         25
res("long")
#> # A tibble: 24 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName key           nr
#>    <chr>        <chr>      <chr>      <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1       protein_Id    10
#>  2 light        A_V2       protein_Id    10
#>  3 light        A_V3       protein_Id    10
#>  4 light        A_V4       protein_Id    10
#>  5 light        B_V1       protein_Id     8
#>  6 light        B_V2       protein_Id     9
#>  7 light        B_V3       protein_Id    10
#>  8 light        B_V4       protein_Id    10
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1    protein_Id    10
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2    protein_Id    10
#> # ℹ 14 more rows
res("plot")


res <- hierarchy_counts_sample(data, config, nr_children = 2)
res()
#> # A tibble: 0 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [0]
#> # ℹ 4 variables: isotopeLabel <chr>, sampleName <chr>, protein_Id <int>,
#> #   peptide_Id <int>
res("long")
#> # A tibble: 0 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [0]
#> # ℹ 4 variables: isotopeLabel <chr>, sampleName <chr>, key <chr>, nr <int>
res("plot")

bb <- prolfqua::sim_lfq_data_protein_config()
#> creating sampleName from fileName column
#> completing cases
res <- hierarchy_counts_sample(bb$data, bb$config, nr_children = 2)
res()
#> # A tibble: 12 × 3
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName protein_Id
#>    <chr>        <chr>           <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1                6
#>  2 light        A_V2                5
#>  3 light        A_V3                3
#>  4 light        A_V4                6
#>  5 light        B_V1                6
#>  6 light        B_V2                6
#>  7 light        B_V3                5
#>  8 light        B_V4                6
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1             6
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2             6
#> 11 light        Ctrl_V3             6
#> 12 light        Ctrl_V4             6
res("long")
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName key           nr
#>    <chr>        <chr>      <chr>      <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1       protein_Id     6
#>  2 light        A_V2       protein_Id     5
#>  3 light        A_V3       protein_Id     3
#>  4 light        A_V4       protein_Id     6
#>  5 light        B_V1       protein_Id     6
#>  6 light        B_V2       protein_Id     6
#>  7 light        B_V3       protein_Id     5
#>  8 light        B_V4       protein_Id     6
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1    protein_Id     6
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2    protein_Id     6
#> 11 light        Ctrl_V3    protein_Id     6
#> 12 light        Ctrl_V4    protein_Id     6
res("plot")

res <- hierarchy_counts_sample(bb$data, bb$config, nr_children = 1)
res()
#> # A tibble: 12 × 3
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName protein_Id
#>    <chr>        <chr>           <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1                9
#>  2 light        A_V2                9
#>  3 light        A_V3                7
#>  4 light        A_V4               10
#>  5 light        B_V1                9
#>  6 light        B_V2                9
#>  7 light        B_V3                8
#>  8 light        B_V4                9
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1             8
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2             8
#> 11 light        Ctrl_V3             9
#> 12 light        Ctrl_V4             9
res("long")
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotopeLabel [1]
#>    isotopeLabel sampleName key           nr
#>    <chr>        <chr>      <chr>      <int>
#>  1 light        A_V1       protein_Id     9
#>  2 light        A_V2       protein_Id     9
#>  3 light        A_V3       protein_Id     7
#>  4 light        A_V4       protein_Id    10
#>  5 light        B_V1       protein_Id     9
#>  6 light        B_V2       protein_Id     9
#>  7 light        B_V3       protein_Id     8
#>  8 light        B_V4       protein_Id     9
#>  9 light        Ctrl_V1    protein_Id     8
#> 10 light        Ctrl_V2    protein_Id     8
#> 11 light        Ctrl_V3    protein_Id     9
#> 12 light        Ctrl_V4    protein_Id     9
res("plot")
